description: Gender of the subject.
Age of the subject on the index date (in 5 year increments).
Year of the index date.
Month of the index date.
One covariate per condition in the condition_occurrence table starting in the long term window.
One covariate per condition in the condition_occurrence table starting in the short term window.
One covariate per condition in the condition_era table overlapping with any part of the long term window.
One covariate per condition in the condition_era table overlapping with any part of the short term window.
One covariate per condition era rolled up to SNOMED groups in the condition_era table overlapping with any part of the long term window.
One covariate per condition era rolled up to SNOMED groups in the condition_era table overlapping with any part of the short term window.
One covariate per drug in the drug_exposure table starting in the long term window.
One covariate per drug in the drug_exposure table starting in the short term window.
One covariate per drug in the drug_era table overlapping with any part of the long term window.
One covariate per drug in the drug_era table overlapping with any part of the long short window.
One covariate per drug rolled up to ATC groups in the drug_era table overlapping with any part of the long term window.
One covariate per drug rolled up to ATC groups in the drug_era table overlapping with any part of the short term window.
One covariate per procedure in the procedure_occurrence table in the long term window.
One covariate per procedure in the procedure_occurrence table in the short term window.
One covariate per device in the device exposure table starting in the long term window.
One covariate per device in the device exposure table starting in the short term window.
One covariate per measurement in the measurement table in the long term window.
One covariate per measurement in the measurement table in the short term window.
One covariate per observation in the observation table in the long term window.
One covariate per observation in the observation table in the short term window.
The Charlson comorbidity index (Romano adaptation) using all conditions prior to the window end.
